thread.title: Driver hits pedestrian, leaves to drop off girlfriend, police say
thread.title_full: Driver hits pedestrian, leaves to drop off girlfriend, police say | OregonLive.com

author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Driver hits pedestrian, leaves to drop off girlfriend, police say
text:
Nam Vu Multnomah County Sheriff's Office A Portland man hit a pedestrian in a Northwest Portland crosswalk, then left the scene to drop off his girlfriend who was riding with him, police and court documents say. Nam N. Vu, 29, told police that he heard a thud Monday while driving near Northwest 15th Avenue and West Burnside Street , according to a probable cause affidavit. He told police he planned to return to the scene after dropping off his girlfriend, the court document said.
The girlfriend said she told Vu to turn around and head back, but he insisted on dropping her off, the affidavit said. It is not clear in the court papers where the final destination was.
Witnesses said two pedestrians were walking through the crosswalk on Burnside when Vu hit one of them, pushing the man 25 to 50 feet, the affidavit said. The injured man was taken to Legacy Emanuel Medical Center with a broken neck, bruised lung and cuts, the document said.
A witness followed Vu as he drove the wrong way down a one-way street, but Vu soon backed into the witness' car and fled, the affidavit said.
Vu was arrested and booked into the Multnomah County Detention Center on accusations of second-degree assault, failure to perform the duties of a driver, reckless driving and reckless endangering.
-- Everton Bailey Jr.
